text: Solid state drives » are more reliable (no moving parts to go wrong) » are considerably lighter (which makes them suitable for laptops) » do not have to ‘get up to speed’ before they work properly » have a lower power consumption » run much cooler than HDDs (both these points again make them very suitable for laptop computers) » are very thin (because they have no moving parts) » access data considerably faster.
